reviews.text: Great menu with a good selection of authentic rice dishes for the evening, tasty breakfast/brunch menu also. We came here twice and really enjoyed each visit. On our second visit we were treated with exceptional service from Cristina. Thank you to all the staff but most of all Cristina whose attention to detail was valuable.

We stayed 3 nights and it was wonderful.  Perfectly located on the beach front. Great choice of restaurants. Close the tram - 25 minutes into the old centre which is worth the visit. Breakfast in the hotel restaurant restaurant was very nice.  No non dairy coffee options.

We just had an improvised lunch there, with an excellent tasty paella, just in front of the beach and sea.  The service started slowly (due to change of staff), but it was worth the wait. Be aware that from 13.30h on, the Spanish come down to eat, so can be crowdy and noisy.

Wind started on the beach so went to find a place to eat and this seemed a good place at first…food wasn’t bad just a bit overpriced but wasn’t the problem! The staff kept the doors open and all the sand from the beach was on our plates, table, everywhere! We told them to shut the door but they shut the doors facing the alley on the side of the restaurant instead of the one towards the beach from where the sand was coming in. My daughter had to go close the door cause they just didn’t care. The floor was filthy with food remains which nobody bothered to clean. Service was very slow as well. My daughter dropped some food on the table by mistake and they kept serving the next course on the dirty table!

Worst breakfast I’ve had in Spain. Overpriced. Men’s bathroom smelled like death itself mixed with a hint of poop. Couldn’t even use it. Probably toxic fumes. Never coming back. Would not recommend unless you’re hungover at the hotel and can’t make it anywhere else. EDIT: El coso, do you think I’m lying?!?!!? How disrespectful. I shared an honest review and you completely disrespect and ignore what I said. Do better.
